summary: SummaryThe Dyson Airstrait dries and straightens hair simultaneously so you can take hair from wet to a finished look - with one machine, no hot plates, and no heat damage¬π
details: DetailsBenefitsReduces time spent drying and styling by an average of 25%‚Å¥Creates a natural straight finish for multiple hair typesEngineered to maintain hair strength and protect shine¬≥FeaturesAirflow is projected downwards at a 45¬∞ angle to create the tension needed to align hair for a smooth end style ‚Äì with less damage and breakage¬≤Glass bead thermistors, located in the machine arms, regulate airflow temperature up to 30 times per second to prevent heat damage and protect hair‚Äôs natural shineDyson Hyperdymium‚Ñ¢ motor has a 13-blade impeller that spins up to 106,000rpm, propelling 11.9 liters of air through the machine per second. This generates 3.6kPa of air pressure, powerful enough to straighten hair as it driesLCD screen features a high-definition color display that shows airflow and temperature settings for easy reference when stylingLock feature allows you to slide the button to lock and unlock the arms of your machine. Use with the arms locked to gently pre-dry hair and create volume from the rootsAuto-pause occurs after three seconds of inactivity. Your machine will automatically pause to save energy. Simply move the machine to restart the airflowTwo styling modes: Wet to Dry and Dry modeThree precise airflow speeds and heat settings in each modeAuto-pause after three seconds of inactivity¬πWhen used in wet to dry mode¬≤When used in wet to dry mode vs. hot plate straighteners which operate with extreme heat¬≥When used in wet to dry mode vs. unstyled, untreated hair‚Å¥Time vs. existing routine. Based on the responses of 250 US Airstrait owners after min. 30 days of use, surveyed by Dyson in August 2023. Actual time saved may vary depending on the individual‚Äôs hair and styling routineIncludesDyson Airstrait‚Ñ¢ StraightenerNon-slip heat matItem 2622508How To UseStraightening from wet:‚Ä¢ Start with towel-dried hair and select Wet mode. Select maximum airflow and high temperature.‚Ä¢ Lock arms and rough dry the roots.‚Ä¢ Once roots are dry, unlock arms and select desired airflow and temperature. Straighten and style damp hair in sections.Straightening from dry:‚Ä¢ Select Dry mode to touch-up or refresh your style. Select desired airflow and temperature, Boost mode is available if required.‚Ä¢ Straighten hair in sections.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Straightening from wet:‚Ä¢ Start with towel-dried hair and select Wet mode. Select maximum airflow and high temperature.‚Ä¢ Lock arms and rough dry the roots.‚Ä¢ Once roots are dry, unlock arms and select desired airflow and temperature. Straighten and style damp hair in sections.Straightening from dry:‚Ä¢ Select Dry mode to touch-up or refresh your style. Select desired airflow and temperature, Boost mode is available if required.‚Ä¢ Straighten hair in sections.

reviews.headline: DESTROYED MY HAIR
reviews.comments: This tool completely ruined my hair. I have fine, wavy hair and after using it I was left with breakage and uneven pieces that will take years to grow back. I expected salon-quality results for the price, but instead it damaged my hair worse than any straightener I've ever used. To make matters worse, Dyson's customer service has been unhelpful and dismissive‚ÄîI couldn't even get proper support for the issue. Save your money and protect your hair.

reviews.headline: RUINED MY HAIR
reviews.comments: I used this a couple times on LOW head very carefully with heat protectant. It SMOKES and my hair is broken off all over the crown. I dont use any other heat. Nothing else has changed. This DAMAGES hair and dyson support is AWFUL to deal with.

reviews.headline: Love it so much,  I bought a 2nd.
reviews.comments: I have long, thick, wavy hair and I have used several different products to straighten my hair. This is by far my favorite tool. It saves me time and      is so much easier than two different styler. Make sure you use a heat protector and anti-frizz product.

reviews.headline: Not for all hair types
reviews.comments: Bought it in high hopes that it would shorten the time I would do my hair after I washed my hair. I have long thick wavy hair. And it's not made for my hair type. When I would use it, I would have to go back in with my regular hair strainer and redo my hair eliminating the point of having a 2 in 1 product.

reviews.headline: Magic!! Try lifesaver for long, thick hair
reviews.comments: My hair is somewhat straight, past my waist, and super thick. I can wash it in the morning and itll still be wet in the evening. It takes forever to dry. If I want to dry it and straighten it, its going to take over an hour. I saw people saying this is way faster, so i gave it a try. I used it right after a shower (so it hadnt even air dried at all) and it took 30 minutes! It makes my hair look so smooth and silky too. I love it and feel like its well worth the money for the time saved by it.

reviews.headline: Amazing!
reviews.comments: I had been eyeing the Dyson Airstrait for awhile amd finally decide to go for it. I could not be happier. I had a Dyson hair dryer for 5-6 years until it broke and have been using one of those hair brush dryers but this- this is fantastic!  It dries my hair and leaves it stick straight with no frizz and it'll stay styled like that until I wash my hair. It usually wait until my hair is 75-80% dry and then do a quick rough dry at the roots, then go in. I pass it through each section 3-4 times then i have beautifully dried, straightened hair!  This was definitely a great investment and i highly recommend

reviews.headline: I would not buy  this again.
reviews.comments: I am left handed. This item did not work for me. This item does not open as wide as a flat iron, therefore very small sections must be done making it very time consuming.

reviews.headline: Good product but not for all
reviews.comments: I have thick wavy frizzy hair and did not like this item for myself. The staighter is heavy.. half way though my arm hurt. Its hard to clamp and hold. It left my hair frizzy but it did straighten it after a going over it 2 times.. wished it would have been awesome like the airwrap.

reviews.headline: Love it- for me
reviews.comments: I bought this a year ago, it's still going strong! My hair dries in a slightly wavy puffy mess. I can use this as a blow dryer to get it almost dry and start straightening, or use it on completely dry hair. The cool shot feature really is the star of the show, you can see a difference immediately when using it and how shiny the hair is after. I would say the noise is pretty loud, and it's kind of a bulky product. My hair doesn't stay as straight when using it as opposed to a standard hair straightener, but it saves me time, and looks more sleek.

reviews.headline: Amazing for my "long" thick, wavy, frizzy hair
reviews.comments:
I have thick wavy hair with plenty of frizz on the top layers, currently about 4 inches past collarbone length and this gets my hair from toweled wet to dry, straight, and smooth in about 20 minutes - something that used to take an hour+. There are tricks to making this work on frizzy, stubborn hair, and i dont think the negative reviews tried very hard honestly. It takes a couple passes to dry and there is frizz after the wet to dry setting, using the dry setting smooths the hair after its dry, and using the cool air sets it for days! 

All i did was watch some youtube videos to learn this and am so grateful that this exists! Absolutelt worth the money if you have the money to spare - waiting for a $100 off coupon also worth the wait!

reviews.headline: LOVE
reviews.comments:
I love the Dyson Airstraight!  It works great for my short bob and gets it super straight.  I didn't feel like there was a huge learning curve at all.  It is a little heavy if you consider the battery pack BUT the battery lays on the counter so Im not having to lift it when Im doing my hair.  
Yes it is pricey but I now have my one and done tool.

reviews.headline: Nope
reviews.comments: Bought it. Returned it. I have slightly wavy hair. This woukd leave my ends so fluffy and frizzy. Is not wirth the 500. Really.  Just dont buy it. Dyson can do better.

reviews.headline: Not for thick hair
reviews.comments: I had high hopes for this. Especially considering the cost of it. I eas extremely disappointed. Its really heavy and impractical for soemone with thick textired hair. Took me 45 minutes to get my hair semi straight with it. Ill stick to my hot tools

reviews.headline: Worth it
reviews.comments: I'm surprised i didn't buy this a long time ago. Good investment fr it makes my hair look healthier if anything. Easy to navigate and feels like out of the salon finish each time‚ò∫Ô∏è

reviews.headline: Dyson Airstrait Straightner
reviews.comments:
Dyson Airstrait Straightner could be a game changer for many.  I did quite a bit of research before purchasing the Airstrait Straightner.  I'm 72 years old with thick white, straight hair.  My hair has a tendency to turn yellow in spots.  I use a heat protector before using the Chi straightener, and use purple shampoo once in awhile.  But I still turn yellow.  In reading about the Dyson Airstrait Straightner, I am hoping since it doesn't have the direct heat, it will help with the yellow situation.   I have used the Dyson Airstrait Straightner 3 times so far. 
There is definitely a learning curve. I love how my hair feels.

reviews.headline: Great tool
reviews.comments: I purchased this product because I have been dealing with excessive hair loss due to medical symptoms. I purchased this to replace my tools round brush and shark flex style which both pulls hair through the tension. I have wavy hair and it does a great job drying. I wil usually use it on damp hair, after letting it air dry for a bit after the shower. It takes me 5-10 minutes. Sometimes I'll use it on dry hair and it is even faster! I only use it twice a week, if that, for the past year and I haven't noticed any form of damage. I do recommend it to others who would like to cut styling time.

reviews.headline: Consider the cost‚Ä¶
reviews.comments: This works! This takes my thick, porous and medium length hair from wet to stick straight in about 25 mins or less. The style is straight, there is no using this product to create waves. If you are ok with the stick straight look, saving time and dropping a significant amount of money on a one trick pony, this is for you. If you need more from a styler besides straightening and time saving, you might want to consider something else. This fills my need and I appreciate the time savings, but the cost is pretty extreme. I took away one star for the price tag.

reviews.headline: Worth the splurge!!!
reviews.comments:
I had been looking  at this for over a year and just couldnt justify the price. I finally got one and my only regret is that i didnt buy it sooner! 
There is a learning curve, it took me 45 minutes when i first got it, but now im down to 20 minutes from wet to straight! 
I have long, fine curly/wavy hair. I section it and with 2 passes it is dry, sleek, and smooth. Better results than using a straightener. My only issue is that it can not get all the way up to the roots, so i lock it and dry the roots with the dryer part and then go over it. Its not a problem for me because my roots are straight, but i could see it being a problem if you have curly roots. 
I know Dyson claims no damage, but this thing gets hot enough that you cant touch your hair, so im a little sceptical about that claim. However, before using this ( when i was using a regular straightener) I would have a handful of haor come out in the shower and now its only a frw strands and my hair just feels healthier. So i definitely think its better than using a straightener. 
It leaves my hair so sleek, smooth, soft, and oin straight. The results last for days too! If you are lije me and on the fence about dropping the money for this hair tool‚Ä¶. Do it! Its amazing and worth every penny! Total game changer!!!

reviews.headline: Not for short hair
reviews.comments: I tried to love this. I gave it four tries and watched a ton of tutorials. I found that this doubled the time it took to do my hair, it made my hair feel like straw and i still had to use a flat iron after. It is not worth the price at all, i will stick to the airwrap!

reviews.headline: Love love love!
reviews.comments: I absolutely love my dyson airstrait! I have beach blonde hair and I only wash my hair once a week, or twice if i have some sort of big event. The airstrait works so well! I set the setting for low (again blonde!) and it takes no time to dry my hair. It comes out super smooth and straight. Id be lost without it! I havent had a problem with it drying out my hair but I follow a pretty strict routine with products that serve my blonde hair. This hair dryer/straightner is perfect! Worth the investment!

faceoff_positive.comments:
I bought this about a month ago..
I was a little hesitant to purchase because of the price.
I'm glad I did purchase the Airstrait!
It literally drys my hair in half the time with no fizzes 
I highly recommend this item.. Actually I have been receiving so my compliments on my hair‚Ä¶ Two of my friends have ordered it since üòä
Five stars ‚≠êÔ∏è!!

faceoff_positive.headline: Great looking hair!!!

faceoff_negative.comments: I bought this item for my curly hair ... I followed the directions and it didn't do as advertised.  I tried twice and both times ended up using my dyson straightener anyways.  Returned the product 3 weeks ago ...still no credit and was told I would not get my tax returned either.  Only the cost of the machine. Until this purchase I was a total dyson supporter with many items ....now I won't ever again!
faceoff_negative.headline: Doesn't work as advertised
